solution_line_template: There was a ${original_price} x {increase_percentage_numerator}/{increase_percentage_denominator} = $<<{original_price}*{increase_percentage_numerator}/{increase_percentage_denominator}={price_increase}>>{price_increase} increase of the original price.
So, the perfume was priced for ${original_price} + ${price_increase} = $<<{original_price}+{price_increase}={price_after_increase}>>{price_after_increase}.

Then, {decrease_percentage_numerator}% of the new price is ${price_after_increase} x {decrease_percentage_numerator}/{decrease_percentage_denominator} = $<<{price_after_increase}*{decrease_percentage_numerator}/{decrease_percentage_denominator}={price_decrease}>>{price_decrease}.
So, the final price is now ${price_after_increase} - ${price_decrease} = $<<{price_after_increase}-{price_decrease}={final_price}>>{final_price}.
Therefore, the final price is ${original_price} - ${final_price} = $<<{original_price}-{final_price}={price_difference}>>{price_difference} lower than the original price.
